answers.answer: go find a lactation consulant or la leche league leader in your area.99% of breastfeeding issues are due to an improper latch.  they can probably fix your problem pretty quickly.  then you don't have to worry about the formula issues at all.formula scares me.  too many problems with obesity, colic, metabolic issues like diabetes down the road.....and that is in formula that isn't contaminated.

Certain batches of powdered Similac were recalled in September due to possible contamination with beetle larvae. After testing recalled batches, Similac found nearly 99% of product was not contaminated. And I know it sounds gross, but ingesting beetle larvae will not actually harm a baby. However, I do agree with Happynifer; if you can get a lactation consultant, sticking with breast milk is ideal. Otherwise, the formula you buy now should be fine (providing you did not buy this back in September). Good luck!

question: So I had been breast feeding my baby since he was born on December 10th, but stopped about 5 days into it because he made blisters on them and I got fever and all that good stuff ): so I started getting the formula for him, but I have been hearing rumors about that milk?! Have any of you heard about that . . the milk having something in it like little creatures LOL idk what they are called!!
title: similac?!
